CriticalSpecialization.corrosive: The target takes @Damage[(1d6 + @item.system.runes.potency)[persistent,acid]]. You gain an item bonus to this acid damage equal to the weapon's item bonus to attack rolls.
CriticalSpecialization.cryo: This weapon freezes part of the target, making it hard for them to move their body. The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} until the start of your next turn.
CriticalSpecialization.flame: The target takes @Damage[(1d6 + @item.system.runes.potency)[persistent,fire]]. You gain an item bonus to this fire damage equal to the weapon's item bonus to attack rolls.
CriticalSpecialization.grenade: Apply the effect listed in the grenade's entry to each creature that rolls a critical failure against the effects of the grenade.
CriticalSpecialization.laser: The target must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|against:class] save against your class DC or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} until the start of your next turn.
CriticalSpecialization.mental: The target must succeed at a @Check[will|against:class] save against your class DC or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} until the start of your next turn.
CriticalSpecialization.missile: The target is knocked back 5 feet from the source of the missile's explosion. This is forced movement.
CriticalSpecialization.plasma: The target takes @Damage[(1d6 + @item.system.runes.potency)[persistent,electricity]]. You gain an item bonus to this electricity damage equal to the weapon's item bonus to attack rolls.
CriticalSpecialization.poison: The target must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|against:class] or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} until the start of your next turn.
CriticalSpecialization.projectile: The target must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|against:class] or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} until the start of your next turn.
CriticalSpecialization.shock: The target must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|against:class] or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1} until the start of your next turn.
CriticalSpecialization.sniper: The target takes 2 additional damage per weapon damage dice.
CriticalSpecialization.sonic: The target must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|against:class] or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.9PR9y0bi4JPKnHPR]{Deafened} for 1 minute.

AccessInfosphere.Description:
You attempt to access a local network, known as an infosphere, to come up with information on a topic. This typically takes 10 minutes of research to find information, with results like Recalling Knowledge on a topic. Larger investigations or topics could require several hours, while single-word answers of information common to that settlement's infosphere may only take a minute, based on the GM's discretion. Significant and longer investigations should use the research subsystem. The GM determines the DC based on the topic you're researching. This can be further influenced by the quality of the local infosphere, what information it might possess on the topic, and how well organized it is.

Critical Success You find the information you were searching for. If this was used on a topic you could have used Recall Knowledge on, you instead find this information in 1 minute.
Success You find the information you were looking for.
Critical Failure You find misleading information thanks to incorrect data or online pranksters. The GM provides you false information on your topic of investigation (or decides to give you no information, as on a failure).

Notes.criticalFailure: Critical Failure You find misleading information thanks to incorrect data or online pranksters. The GM provides you false information on your topic of investigation (or decides to give you no information, as on a failure).
Notes.criticalSuccess: Critical Success You find the information you were searching for. If this was used on a topic you could have used Recall Knowledge on, you instead find this information in 1 minute.
Notes.success: Success You find the information you were looking for.

AccessInfosphere.Title: Access Infosphere

AreaFire.Description: You hit each creature in the designated area with a range equal to the weapon's range increment (for cone or line) or the designated radius of the explosion (for burst). For burst, you can position the center point anywhere within your first range increment. Any creatures in the area must succeed at a basic reflex save against your class DC plus the tracking value of the weapon. This damage is area damage. Creatures who critically fail this save are subject to effects that occur on a critical hit with this weapon, including the weapon's critical specialization effect. Area Fire has an expend equal to the value listed on the weapon.
AreaFire.Title: Area Fire

AutoFire.Description: You hit each creature in a cone with a range equal to half the weapon's range increment without making an attack roll. Any creatures in the area take damage equal to the weapon's damage (basic reflex save against your class DC plus the tracking value of the weapon). This damage is area damage. Creatures that critically fail this save are subject to effects that occur on a critical hit with this weapon, including the weapon's critical specialization effect. Automatic Fire has an expend equal to the number of targets in the area Ã— 2.
AutoFire.Title: Auto-Fire

Drive.Description:
You pilot your vehicle to move. Decide how many actions you intend to spend before you begin Driving. The effects depend on the number of actions you spend. You can't Drive through spaces occupied by creatures, even if they are allies.

1 Attempt a Piloting check. On a success, the vehicle moves up to its Speed and can turn normally. On a failure, the vehicle moves its Speed in a straight line. On a critical failure, the vehicle moves its Speed in a straight line and becomes uncontrolled.
2 (reckless) The vehicle moves up to twice its Speed in a straight line at the vehicle's current heading.
3 (reckless) You take a -5 penalty on your piloting check to maintain control of the vehicle. The vehicle moves up to three times its Speed in a straight line at the vehicle's current heading.

Drive1.Description: Attempt a Piloting check. On a success, the vehicle moves up to its Speed and can turn normally. On a failure, the vehicle moves its Speed in a straight line. On a critical failure, the vehicle moves its Speed in a straight line and becomes uncontrolled.

Notes.criticalFailure: Critical Failure The vehicle moves its Speed in a straight line and becomes uncontrolled.
Notes.failure: Failure The vehicle moves its Speed in a straight line.
Notes.success: Success The vehicle moves up to its Speed and can turn normally.

Drive1.Title: Drive1

Drive2.Description: (reckless) The vehicle moves up to twice its Speed in a straight line at the vehicle's current heading.

Notes.failure: Failure The vehicle moves its Speed in a straight line along its most recent heading, drifting up to 45 degrees at the GM's discretion, and becomes uncontrolled.
Notes.success: Success The vehicle moves up to twice its Speed in a straight line at the vehicle's current heading.

Drive2.Title: Drive2

Drive3.Description: (reckless) You take a -5 penalty on your piloting check to maintain control of the vehicle. The vehicle moves up to three times its Speed in a straight line at the vehicle's current heading.

Notes.failure: Failure The vehicle moves its Speed in a straight line along its most recent heading, drifting up to 45 degrees at the GM's discretion, and becomes uncontrolled.
Notes.success: Success The vehicle moves up to three times its Speed in a straight line at the vehicle's current heading.

Drive3.Title: Drive3

Drive.Title: Drive

Hack.Description:
You try to access, control, or make changes to an active, secured system. In most cases, this is going to be an attempt made against a local computer system that you access directly or indirectly through the use of a hacking toolkit. Attempt a Computers check to determine if you can access the targeted system. Computers with improved systems might require multiple successes to access.

Critical Success You access the system, or you achieve two successes toward accessing a system requiring more than one success. You leave no trace of your tampering.
Success You access the system, or you achieve one success toward accessing a system that requires more than one success.
Failure You fail to access the system or achieve any success toward accessing a system that requires more than one success. Some computerized systems might have security measures that activate on a failure.
Critical Failure You activate specially ingrained security protocols or completely lock yourself out of the system. Being locked out of a system prevents you from attempting another check to access it for the next hour.

Notes.criticalFailure: Critical Failure You activate specially ingrained security protocols or completely lock yourself out of the system. Being locked out of a system prevents you from attempting another check to access it for the next hour.
Notes.criticalSuccess: Critical Success You access the system, or you achieve two successes toward accessing a system requiring more than one success. You leave no trace of your tampering.
Notes.failure: Failure You fail to access the system or achieve any success toward accessing a system that requires more than one success. Some computerized systems might have security measures that activate on a failure.
Notes.success: Success You access the system, or you achieve one success toward accessing a system that requires more than one success.

Hack.Title: Hack

Navigate.Description:
You plan a short journey. While this is most often used when traveling with a mech, vehicle, or starship, the same skill can be used to determine the optimal route to take while traveling on foot. This lets you plan a general heading on a planetoid or guide your starship on an in-system voyage. If you are navigating a short journey, you typically attempt a Piloting check only once per day, but some environments or changes might necessitate rolling more often. The GM determines the DC and how long this activity takes (usually just a minute or so). More unusual locales or those you're unfamiliar with might require you to have a minimum proficiency rank to Navigate.

Critical Success You get an excellent sense of where you are. If you are in an environment with cardinal directions, you know them exactly.
Success You gain enough orientation to avoid becoming hopelessly lost. If you are in an environment with cardinal directions, you have a sense of those directions.

Notes.criticalSuccess: Critical Success You get an excellent sense of where you are. If you are in an environment with cardinal directions, you know them exactly.
Notes.success: Success You gain enough orientation to avoid becoming hopelessly lost. If you are in an environment with cardinal directions, you have a sense of those directions.

Navigate.Title: Navigate

PlotCourse.Description:
You prepare for a longer journey into the stars, likely making use of your starship's Drift Engine (or similar FTL device). Attempt a Piloting check to determine if you can chart a suitable path to your ultimate destination. The GM determines how long this activity takes and the DC.

Critical Success You manage to reach your destination in half the expected time (minimum 1 day).
Success You create a usable navigational plan that gets you to your intended destination on time.
Failure Your plan has several problems, and you end up reaching your destination late.
Critical Failure You arrive in an unfamiliar star system, requiring you to plot a new course to your destination (likely at an increased DC due to the unfamiliar starting point).

Notes.criticalFailure: Critical Failure You arrive in an unfamiliar star system, requiring you to plot a new course to your destination (likely at an increased DC due to the unfamiliar starting point).
Notes.criticalSuccess: Critical Success You manage to reach your destination in half the expected time (minimum 1 day).
Notes.failure: Failure Your plan has several problems, and you end up reaching your destination late.
Notes.success: Success You create a usable navigational plan that gets you to your intended destination on time.

PlotCourse.Title: Plot Course

Program.Description:
You spend your time creating lines of computer code that can be integrated into various computerized systems. You need the Programmer skill feat to write computer code, Programming items that have the virtual trait. You must have the formulas to craft these items, but they can often be found sold by other programmers on an infosphere. You can buy lines of code from other programmers to help complete your virtual item. You can use the Program action to create formulas for tech items if you have the Inventor skill feat. You can use the Program action to create tech items without the virtual trait by using a creator capsule if you have the Fabricator skill feat.

Critical Success Your attempt is successful. Each additional day spent Programming reduces the code needed to complete the item by an amount based on your level + 1 and your proficiency rank in Computers.
Success Your attempt is successful. Each additional day spent Programming reduces the materials needed to complete the item by an amount based on your level and your proficiency rank.
Failure You fail to complete the item. You can salvage some of the code you've written for its full value. If you want to try again, you must start over.
Critical Failure You fail to complete the item. 10% of the code you've written or purchased is unusable, but you can salvage the rest. If you want to try again, you must start over.

Notes.criticalFailure: Critical Failure You fail to complete the item. 10% of the code you've written or purchased is unusable, but you can salvage the rest. If you want to try again, you must start over.
Notes.criticalSuccess: Critical Success Your attempt is successful. Each additional day spent Programming reduces the code needed to complete the item by an amount based on your level + 1 and your proficiency rank in Computers.
Notes.failure: Failure You fail to complete the item. You can salvage some of the code you've written for its full value. If you want to try again, you must start over.
Notes.success: Success Your attempt is successful. Each additional day spent Programming reduces the materials needed to complete the item by an amount based on your level and your proficiency rank.

Program.Title: Program

RunOver.Description:
You try to run over creatures or ram another vehicle with your vehicle. If you maintain control of your vehicle, it moves up to twice its Speed in a straight line at the vehicle's current heading. You attempt to run over any creatures in your path two sizes smaller than the vehicle or smaller, and you can attempt to ram one target creature or object in your path one size smaller than the vehicle or larger.

Each creature in your path, including a rammed target, takes the vehicle's collision damage (basic Reflex save at vehicle's collision DC). If the rammed target is a vehicle, its pilot can attempt a piloting check in place of this Reflex save, with the same results. If the target of your ram takes damage, you and your vehicle each take collision damage (no save) and your movement ends.

Notes.failure: Failure The vehicle moves its Speed in a straight line along its most recent heading, drifting up to 45 degrees at the GM's discretion, and becomes uncontrolled.

RunOver.Title: Run Over

Stop.Description: You bring the vehicle to a stop.
Stop.Title: Stop

Notes.success: Success Move half Speed to gain a +2 status bonus to AC.

Stunt.Description:
You perform a stunt while Driving your vehicle, temporarily improving its effective capabilities at the risk of losing control. Drive your vehicle and choose a stunt. All piloting checks attempted as part of your Stunt receive the listed penalty, including piloting checks made to take a reckless action. If the Drive action and Stunt are both reckless, you must attempt the piloting check to keep control of the vehicle twice.

Stunts
StuntPenaltyBenefit
Back Off-1Move half Speed backwards.
Evade-1Move half Speed to gain a +1 status bonus to AC.
Flip and Burn-1Move half Speed, then turn and direction.
Barrel Roll-2Move half Speed to gain a +2 status bonus to AC.
Flyby-2Move half Speed through an enemy square.
Drift-2Move half Speed sideways without turning.
Turn in Place-2Turn, then move full Speed.

Notes.success: Success Move half Speed sideways without turning.
Success Move half Speed to gain a +1 status bonus to AC.
Success Move half Speed, then turn and direction.
Success Move half Speed through an enemy square.

Notes.failure: Failure The vehicle moves its Speed in a straight line along its most recent heading, drifting up to 45 degrees at the GM's discretion, and becomes uncontrolled.

Stunt.Title: Stunt

TakeControl.Description: You take control of a vehicle. Attempt a Piloting check; on a success, you become the vehicle's pilot, or regain control of the vehicle if it was uncontrolled. Some vehicles have complicated controls that cause this action to become a multi-action activity, and most vehicles take at least 3 actions if they aren't activated.

Notes.success: Success You become the vehicle's pilot, or regain control of the vehicle if it was uncontrolled.

TakeControl.Title: Take Control

ConvergentEvolution.Prompt: Select a 5th-level or lower ancestry feat.

ManifoldEvolution.Prompt: Select a 17th-level or lower ancestry feat.

CairnForm.CriticalHit: The target must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|against:class] or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1} for 1 round.

PeerPressure.Label: Peer Pressure
PeerPressure.Note: Your psychic shock gains the arc trait, but it deals mental damage rather than electricity damage.

CutEmDeep.Note: When you successfully Demoralize the target of your @UUID[Compendium.sf2e-anachronism.actions.Item.cmCtfURzpbzkxWsy]{Get 'Em!}, the target doesn't become immune to your further attempts to Demoralize them.

LeadByExample.DescriptionAlteration: When you use an act of leadership after issuing one or more envoy directives earlier that turn, you can choose one envoy directive you activated. You grant the lead by example benefits for that directive even if you didn't meet the usual requirements to lead by example. You can do this once per turn.

EffortlessInfluencer.Note:
When you succeed at a check with Deception, Diplomacy, or Intimidation, allies within 60 feet who witnessed your success gain a +1 status bonus to the next check they attempt with that skill within 1 minute (or a +2 bonus if your check was a critical success).

@UUID[Compendium.sf2e-anachronism.feat-effects.Item.ZQM4vfHEKgxvNJik]{Effect: Effortless Influencer}

LeadByExample.ToggleLabel: Get Em! â€” Initial Lead by Example Strike

HangInThere.CriticalSuccess: The target gains temporary Hit Points equal to double their level plus your Charisma modifier. @UUID[Compendium.sf2e-anachronism.feat-effects.Item.B4JhFkbk5WHmWcOZ]{Effect: Hang In There!}
HangInThere.Success: The target gains temporary Hit Points their level plus your Charisma modifier. @UUID[Compendium.sf2e-anachronism.feat-effects.Item.B4JhFkbk5WHmWcOZ]{Effect: Hang In There!}

PardonMe.Note: When you successfully Tumble Through using Deception, the foe whose space you passed through is @UUID[Compendium.sf2e-anachronism.conditions.Item.enA7BxAjBb7ns1iF]{Suppressed} until the end of its next turn.

SavvyInfluencer.Note: The first time per day when you roll a natural 1 on a Deception, Diplomacy, or Intimidation check, you don't automatically reduce your degree of success (you get a critical failure only if your result is 10 lower than the DC).

SmoothDiversions.Failure: Creatures only become aware you were trying to trick them if you critically fail to Create a Diversion. Otherwise the creature assumes that your diversion was part of your regular bravado.
SmoothDiversions.Success: When you succeed at an attempt to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.GkmbTGfg8KcgynOA]{Create a Diversion}, you can immediately @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.VMozDqMMuK5kpoX4]{Sneak} or Step as a free action.

TakeEmAlive.ToggleLabel: Take 'Em Alive â€” Add charisma to Strike damage

ForceField.Advanced: Attempt a @Check[flat|dc:19] check. On a success, the critical hit becomes a normal hit.
ForceField.Elite: Attempt a @Check[flat|dc:17] check. On a success, the critical hit becomes a normal hit.
ForceField.Paragon: Attempt a @Check[flat|dc:15] check. On a success, the critical hit becomes a normal hit.
ForceField.Superior: Attempt a @Check[flat|dc:18] check. On a success, the critical hit becomes a normal hit.
ForceField.Tactical: Attempt a @Check[flat|dc:20] check. On a success, the critical hit becomes a normal hit.
ForceField.Ultimate: Attempt a @Check[flat|dc:16] check. On a success, the critical hit becomes a normal hit.

Gluon.Note: On a critical hit, the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} until it recovers from the persistent bleed damage.
Gluon.Title: Gluon Solarian Crystal

Note.Commercial: On a critical hit while you're graviton attuned, the target must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:23] save or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} until the end of your next turn.

Tactical.CriticalHit: On a critical hit while you're graviton attuned, the target must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:31] save or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for 2 rounds.
Tactical.Hit: When you hit an @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} creature with your solar weapon while graviton attuned, the target must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:31] save or be knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}.

Note.Commercial: On a critical hit while you're photon attuned, the target must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:23] save or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} for 1 round.
Note.Tactical: On a critical hit while you're photon attuned, the target must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:31] save or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} for 2 rounds.

EntropicDestabilizer.Note: If the target has a shield raised, the shield takes the same amount of persistent damage (its wielder rolls the flat check to see if the persistent damage ends, or the GM rolls if the shield is no longer in someone's possession). Unlike normal void damage, the void damage from an entropic destabilizer damages objects, constructs, and the like by eroding them away.

FearProjector.CriticalNoteCommercial: When you critically hit with this weapon, the target becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}.
FearProjector.CriticalNoteTactical: When you critically hit with this weapon, the target becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2}.

FrostModule.CriticalNoteCommercial: On a critical hit, the target is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} until the end of your next turn unless it succeeds at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:24] save.
FrostModule.CriticalNoteTactical: On a critical hit, the target is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} until the end of your next turn unless it succeeds at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:34] save.

HolyModule.CriticalNoteCommercial: On a critical hit, the target is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} (or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} if unholy) until the end of your next turn unless it succeeds at a @Check[fortitude|dc:28] save.
HolyModule.CriticalNoteTactical: On a critical hit, the target is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} (or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} if unholy) until the end of your next turn unless it succeeds at a @Check[fortitude|dc:35] save.

Loudener.CriticalNoteCommercial: On a critical hit, the target must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:24] save or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.9PR9y0bi4JPKnHPR]{Deafened} for 1 minute (or 1 hour on a critical failure).
Loudener.CriticalNoteTactical: On a critical hit, the target must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:34] save or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.9PR9y0bi4JPKnHPR]{Deafened} for 1 minute (or 1 hour on a critical failure).

ShockModule.CriticalNote: On a critical hit, electricity arcs out to deal an equal amount of electricity damage to up to two other creatures of your choice within 10 feet of the target.

Silencer.CriticalNoteTactical: On a critically successful Strike, the target becomes unable to make sound. The target can't use sonic attacks, nor can it use actions with the auditory trait. This also prevents the target from casting spells due to the incantations or sounds involved in casting, with the exception of subtle spells. The target can resist the effects of the silencer with a successful @Check[will|dc:27] save.

ScrappersIngenuity.Prompt: Was the device higher level than you?

ArcticBite.Note: Ignores an amount of the target's cold resistance equal to your level. A creature's immunities are unaffected.

ElectricKalo.Alteration: If you cast this spell with only 1 target, you gain electricity resistance equal to half your level (minimum 1) until the end of your next turn.

GelidBite.Note: On a critical hit, the target is also @UUID[Compendium.sf2e-anachronism.conditions.Item.enA7BxAjBb7ns1iF]{Suppressed} until the end of your next turn, unless it succeeds at a @Check[fortitude|against:class-spell] save against your class DC or spell DC, whichever is higher.

Akashic.Harmony: When you Transfer Vitality, the target receives a psychic download from the Akashic Record and can immediately attempt to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.1OagaWtBpVXExToo]{Recall Knowledge} as a reaction. This doesn't trigger any special abilities, reactions, or free actions that trigger when a creature uses Recall Knowledge.
Akashic.PerfectHarmony: You create an extradimensional memory palace that functions as @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.vPWMEyVTreMOoFnm]. Creating a door to the demiplane takes 1 minute. The memory palace keeps the same layout each time you access it, adjustable during daily preparations. Each phantasmal minion in your memory palace functions as an akashic assistant (like those created by the *akashic assistant* spell).

ElementalBarrier.Air: Defending against electricity or sonic damage
ElementalBarrier.Earth: Defending against bludgeoning or piercing damage
ElementalBarrier.Metal: Defending against acid or slashing damage

Harmony.Addendum: When you Transfer Vitality, choose an elemental trait: air, earth, fire, metal, water, or wood. If one or more of your elemental epiphanies are active, you must select the elemental trait you chose as part of casting those spells. Until the end of their next turn, the targetâ€™s next Strike deals damage based on the chosen trait (your choice), rather than its typical damage type: electricity or sonic for air, bludgeoning or piercing for earth, acid or slashing for metal, fire for fire, bludgeoning or cold for water, or piercing or poison for wood.

PerfectHarmony.Addendum: When you heal a bonded ally with Transfer Vitality, your ally gains resistance equal to half your mystic level to the two damage types chosen during your daily preparations until the beginning of your next turn.

Harmony.Addendum: When you Transfer Vitality, attempt to counteract one affliction affecting the target, or attempt to counteract one effect of your choice imposing one of the following conditions on the target: @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.9PR9y0bi4JPKnHPR]{Deafened}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened}.

PerfectHarmony.AddendumCounteract: In addition, if you didn't counteract the effect, but you would've if its counteract rank were 2 lower, instead suppress the effect until the beginning of your next turn. The effect's duration doesn't elapse while it's suppressed.
PerfectHarmony.AddendumExpanded: When you Transfer Vitality, attempt to counteract one affliction affecting the target, or attempt to counteract one effect of your choice imposing one of the following conditions on the target: @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.9PR9y0bi4JPKnHPR]{Deafened}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened}, and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned}.

Harmony.Addendum: When you Transfer Vitality, you can extend the duration of any active epiphany from the rhythm connection by 1 round.

PerfectHarmony.Addendum: The first time each round you Transfer Vitality, the target who regained Hit Points can Stride as a free action. This has the traversal trait.

Harmony.Addendum: When you Transfer Vitality, the target's shadow darkens and swells, reducing bright light within a @Template[type:emanation|distance:10] of the target to dim light. This is a form of magical darkness and can overcome non-magical light sources or attempt to counteract magical light. The target becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} while in this dim light and can use the concealed condition to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.XMcnh4cSI32tljXa]{Hide}. This lasts until the end of your next turn.

PerfectHarmony.Addendum: When you Transfer Vitality, the target can use @UUID[Compendium.sf2e-anachronism.actions.Item.u9NU2bULHg3S5FaP]{Umbral Stride} once before the end of their next turn.

WasteNot.Addendum: Your vitality network gains @Damage[(2*@item.rank)[healing]] Hit Points.

Aim.CoverToggle: Aim â€” Reduce target's cover bonus

DangerAwareness.ToggleLabel: Danger Awareness â€” Gain Perception bonus

DefensiveGunner.ToggleLabel: Defensive Gunner â€” Gun already has the parry trait.

EnhancedExploit.FreeActionNote: You can @UUID[Compendium.sf2e-anachronism.actions.Item.qbyer2woEdGXZzoR]{Sabotage} as a free action whenever you critically hit a tech creature with a melee or ranged attack, targeting the triggering creature.
EnhancedExploit.ReactionNote: You can @UUID[Compendium.sf2e-anachronism.actions.Item.qbyer2woEdGXZzoR]{Sabotage} as a reaction whenever a tech creature or a creature using a tech weapon critically fails a melee attack roll against you, targeting the triggering creature or weapon.

EnhancedExploit.Note: If you fail your first ranged Strike against your mark using a weapon in the sniper weapon group, you Reload your sniper weapon as a free action. The Strike doesn't count toward your multiple attack penalty.
EnhancedExploit.ToggleLabel: Enhanced Exploit â€” First ranged Strike against mark

Promession.Note: The target gets a result one degree of success worse than it rolled on its Fortitude save. @UUID[Compendium.sf2e-anachronism.spell-effects.Item.Mjzoqg7MpTst3koD]{Spell Effect: Promession}

ClingingBite.GrabAlteration: You can only use Grab following a successful critical hit with your jaws (rather than on a hit) or when you have a creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained}.

AttunedWards.GravitonNote: The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} for 1 round. This increases to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2} if this is the second time it hit you this turn.
AttunedWards.Label: Attuned Wards

CosmicInfusion.PhotonToggle: Cosmic Infusion â€” Deal vitality damage

HarmonicConvergence.Alteration: When you use an action with the disharmony trait, you gain a number of temporary Hit Points equal to half your level.

NimbusSurge.GravitonNote: If the Strike is a critical success, the target must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|against:solarian] save against your class DC or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} until the end of its turn.
NimbusSurge.PhotonNote: If the Strike is a critical success, the target must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|against:solarian] save against your class DC or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} until the start of its turn.

ShatteringImpact.GravitonNote: On a hit, the target takes a â€“10-foot status penalty to Speed until the start of your next turn. @UUID[Compendium.sf2e-anachronism.feat-effects.Item.Ll3uZdiSqaszP3fn]{Effect: Shattering Impact}

Graviton.Note: On a critical success, you can attempt a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.ge56Lu1xXVFYUnLP]{Trip} using your Athletics even if you don't have a free hand or are not adjacent to the target.

Description.PartOne: Your solar manifestations now include the ability to create a small shield of celestial energy. This energy shield does not require a hand to use, as it floats near you. You can Raise a Shield, giving you a +1 circumstance bonus to AC until the start of your next turn.
Description.PartTwo: While the shield is raised, you can use the Shield Block reaction with your shield. The shield has 5 + 2 Ã— your level Hit Points and no Hardness. Your shield can't be broken, but if it's destroyed, you cannot manifest a new shield for 10 minutes. If your shield vanishes due to you losing attunement, when you Attune to reform it, the shield returns with however many Hit Points it previously had. The shield regains all its lost Hit Points during your daily preparations or whenever you rest for at least 10 minutes, even if it's been destroyed.

GravitonAttuned.Label: Graviton-Attuned
GravitonAttuned.Note: Your shield has Hardness equal to half your level rounded up.

PhotonAttuned.Label: Photon-Attuned
PhotonAttuned.Note: If your shield is destroyed, adjacent enemies must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:resolve(@actor.system.attributes.classDC.value)] save against your class DC or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} for 1 round. On a critical failure they are instead @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} for 1 round.

Graviton.Note: When you successfully Strike a creature using your solar weapon, that creature's space and all squares adjacent to it are difficult terrain for that creature until the end of its next turn.

GravitonAttuned.Label: Graviton-Attuned
GravitonAttuned.Note: When you successfully Strike a creature using your solar weapon, that creature treats all squares adjacent to the square where they were struck as being difficult terrain until the end of its next turn.

StellarResilience.Note: When you roll a success on a Fortitude or Will save against a mental or incapacitation effect, you can @UUID[Compendium.sf2e-anachronism.actions.Item.3xDhpvORBmK6AtcI]{Attune} as a free action.

ArmorStorm.Note: When you successfully Disarm, Grapple, Reposition, Shove, or Trip a creature, it becomes @UUID[Compendium.sf2e-anachronism.conditions.Item.enA7BxAjBb7ns1iF]{Suppressed} until the start of your next turn.

IntimidatingTaunt.Label: Intimidating Taunt
IntimidatingTaunt.SuccessAddendum: Only the first hostile action that the creature takes is affected.
IntimidatingTaunt.ToggleLabel: Intimidating Taunt â€” Reduce Save DCs

SuppressingFire.Note: If you make an attack with a weapon that has the area trait, enemies in the affected area who fail their save against your attack become @UUID[Compendium.sf2e-anachronism.conditions.Item.enA7BxAjBb7ns1iF]{Suppressed} until the start of your next turn.

BoomingBootloader.Alteration: All creatures in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:10] around the creature you summoned take 1d4 sonic damage per spell rank (@Damage[((@item.level)d4)[sonic]]).

DebugSpell.Alteration: Any die you roll for damage that has a result lower than 2 becomes a result of 2 instead.

DeleteRootAccess.Alteration: Replace *delete's* target with "one construct or tech creature." Instead of delete's normal effects, the target becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.9qGBRpbX9NEwtAAr] by you if its level is equal to or lower than your level â€“ 3. It can attempt a Will saving throw to resist being controlled by you. If the target is already under someone else's command, the controlling creature also rolls a saving throw, and the construct uses the better result.

DegreeOfSuccess.CriticalFailure: **Critical Failure** As failure, but the duration is 1 hour.
DegreeOfSuccess.CriticalSuccess: **Critical Success** The target is unaffected and is temporarily immune for 24 hours.
DegreeOfSuccess.Failure: **Failure** The construct or tech creature becomes a minion under your control. The spell gains a duration of 1 minute, but it is dismissed if you or an ally attacks the construct or tech minion.

GrenadeSpell.Alteration: If your next action is to Cast a Spell with a burst effect that requires a Reflex save, the spell does not immediately take effect, but it instead is installed into the held grenade. Until the end of your next turn, any creatures caught in the Area Fire of the grenade are also affected by the installed spell; creatures do not make a separate Reflex save against the spell and instead use the same result they rolled against the grenade.

HardlightIllusion.Alteration: Creatures cannot attempt to disbelieve your illusion by merely touching or attempting to damage it, but they can still use the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.BlAOM2X92SI6HMtJ]{Seek} action to examine it and attempt to disbelieve your illusion. When a creature succeeds (but not critically succeeds) at a Perception check or Will save to disbelieve the illusion, you can reprogram it as a reaction by attempting a Computers check against the target's Perception DC. If you succeed, the target fails to disbelieve the illusion.

OvervoltResistor.Alteration: The spell ignores an amount of the target's resistance to acid, cold, electricity, fire, or sonic damage equal to your level. This applies to all damage the spell deals, including persistent damage and damage caused by an ongoing effect of the spell, such as the wall created by wall of fire. A creature's immunities are unaffected.

ShatterSpell.Alteration: You successfully counteract the target, one creature of your choice occupying the same space as the spell effect or magic item takes force damage equal to 1d4 Ã— the target's counteract rank with a basic Reflex save against your spell DC; if the target has a trait corresponding to a type of damage, such as fire, this effect deals that damage instead of force.

SignalBoost.Alteration: Increase the spell's range by 30 feet. As is standard for increasing spell ranges, if the spell normally has a range of touch, you extend its range to 30 feet.

SplitTunneling.Alteration: You can choose a second target within range. You roll a single attack roll and compare the result to the AC of both targets. This counts as one attack for your multiple attack penalty. To the second target, the spell deals only half the amount of damage it would normally deal for its degree of success, and it has no effects beyond the spell's initial damage (such as imposing conditions or penalties).

SudoSpell.Alteration: The spell's energy reverberates and echoes. You can Cast the Spell a second time before the end of your next turn without expending a spell slot.

AnchoringStrike.CriticalSuccess: The Strike gains the anchoring trait. You can reroll the damage dice rolled for this strike, but you must use the second result, even if it's worse.
AnchoringStrike.Success: The Strike gains the anchoring trait.

Analyst.QuantumField: You see and understand infinite possibilities and complex theoretical equations as clearly as though they were etched into your surroundings. When you @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.BlAOM2X92SI6HMtJ]{Seek} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.1OagaWtBpVXExToo]{Recall Knowledge}, you can apply the result against two related creatures, hazards, unattended objects, and effects in your quantum field. Whenever you sustain your quantum field, you can Seek or Recall Knowledge against an appropriate target in your quantum field as a free action.

Anomaly.QuantumField: Your movements blur as images of alternate iterations of you flicker around your current form, and your speech echoes with a chorus of otherworldly sounds. Any time an enemy within the quantum field attempts an action with the concentrate trait, the action is disrupted unless they succeed at a @Check[type:flat|dc:5].

GapInfluenced.QuantumField: Supernatural static swirls around you, making thoughts slippery for those unaccustomed to your presence. You are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} to creatures within your quantum field. When a creature within your quantum field hits you with an attack, you lose this benefit against that creature until the start of your next turn.

Precog.QuantumField: You have a modicum of control of the flow of time that surrounds you, allowing you to speed yourself and others up, or decrease the flow of time for others. An enemy creature that uses a move action inside your quantum field takes a â€“5-foot status penalty to its Speed during that action. You and your allies gain a +5-foot status bonus to Speed when you use a move action inside your quantum field during that action.

QuantumAnalysis.FortuneToggleLabel: Quantum Analysis â€” Attacking enemy within Quantum Field
QuantumAnalysis.Label: Quantum Analysis
QuantumAnalysis.Note: You ignore any flat check required due to the creature being @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden}, or behind cover.

QuantumField.AdjacentLabel: Inside or Adjacent to Your Quantum Field

ZoneOverlap.DebrisZone: Debris Zone becomes greater difficult terrain.
ZoneOverlap.RadiantZone: The zone overlap forces creatures to attempt another saving throw.
ZoneOverlap.TwistedDarkZone: Twisted Dark Zone ignores the temporary immunity of creatures that previously critically succeeded at the save for 1 round.

TraitDescription.Aeon: You can fit one aeon stone or spell gem into this weapon as a single action with the interact trait. While you possess the weapon with an aeon stone in its indentation, you gain all the benefits of the aeon stone as if it were orbiting your head. While the weapon has a spell gem attached, you gain a number of bonus battery charges equal to the spell gem's item level Ã— 5. These charges regenerate during your daily preparations. In addition, you can use the spell gem while wielding the weapon, though using the gem in this manner still destroys it.
TraitDescription.Analog: This weapon eschews advanced electronics, computers systems, and electric power sources, but was manufactured and calibrated using advanced technology. This weapon is immune to abilities that target technology. Weapon runes don't function on this weapon unless this weapon also has the archaic trait.
TraitDescription.Anchoring: You can use abilities with the anchoring trait only while your quantum field is activated. If you use the ability on your turn, in addition to their stated effects, they automatically Sustain your quantum field.
TraitDescription.Arc: The attack arcs to the closest enemy creature within 10 feet of the initial target. If the secondary target's AC is lower than your attack roll result, you deal electricity damage to that creature equal to 1 per weapon damage die.
TraitDescription.Archaic: This weapon is crafted using traditional methods and materials but is not suitable for striking modern armor. All weapons from the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game have the archaic trait. Weapon runes function normally with archaic weapons.
TraitDescription.Area: Weapons with this trait can only fire using the Area Fire action.
TraitDescription.Attuned: You can't use abilities with the attuned trait while you're unattuned. Many attuned abilities require you to be specifically graviton-attuned or photon-attuned, while others can grant additional benefits based on your current stellar attunement.
TraitDescription.Automatic: In addition to a normal Strike, you can fire this weapon using the Auto-Fire action.
TraitDescription.Biotech: Biotech augmentations include modifications to your DNA combined with implants of biological origin that integrate into your physiology. Biotech augmentations aren't magical, though many originate from (or imitate) creatures that are magical in nature.
TraitDescription.Boost: You can charge up a weapon with this special property with an Interact action by spending 1 expend of the weapon's magazine. If the boost trait lists one or more traits, apply the traits listed to the next attack you make with this weapon. If the boost trait lists a value, increase the weapon's damage by the listed amount for each weapon die on the next attack you make with the weapon. This increases the weapon's damage and is multiplied on a critical hit. Boosting this weapon more than once before firing it doesn't have any extra effect, and the extra charge dissipates if the weapon is not fired by the end of your next turn.
TraitDescription.Breakdown: This weapon can be taken apart into multiple small pieces. While broken down, the weapon is treated as small object with light bulk. Breaking down or reassembling a breakdown weapon is a 3-action activity, which has the manipulate trait and requires two hands.
TraitDescription.Caster: This weapon can be powered by casting a spell (including a cantrip) with two or more actions. If you do, resolve the spell normally. Once the spell is cast, if it had the acid, cold, fire, electricity, spirit, sonic, vitality, or void trait, the weapon deals damage of that type instead of its usual damage until the end of your next turn or until you cast another spell. If the spell deals more than one type of damage, choose one when you fire the weapon. If the weapon has the Aeon trait and a spell gem installed, you can use one of the previously listed traits if the spell of the spell gem slotted in the weapon has that trait, and this does not require you to cast the spell and is a constant effect.
TraitDescription.Charm: A charm is Installed into a specific type of item, usually a weapon, armor, or shield, but does not occupy an upgrade slot. You can only Install one charm into an item at a time. You must be wielding or wearing an item to activate a charm attached to it.
TraitDescription.Compact: You can Raise a Shield with your compact shield as long as you have that hand free or are holding a light object that's not a weapon in that hand.
TraitDescription.Critical: This weapon uses the critical weapon specialization of the listed weapon type rather than its own.
TraitDescription.Cycle: Actions with the cycle trait change your current stellar attunement to its opposite state. When you take such an action with this trait, you benefit from the additional effect of your current attunement if the action had the attuned trait, but once you complete the action, your attunement changes to its counterpart (so graviton-attuned if you were photon-attuned before taking the action, or vice versa).
TraitDescription.Directive: Actions with this trait are special orders that provide benefits for your allies if they follow them. Your allies must be able to sense you to benefit from your directives. This action has the auditory or visual trait depending on how you inspire your allies.
TraitDescription.Disharmony: Actions with the disharmony trait change your current stellar attunement to being unattuned. When you take such an action with this trait, you benefit from the additional effect of your current attunement if the action had the attuned trait, but once you complete the action, you become unattuned.
TraitDescription.Expend: This indicates how much ammunition is consumed with each ranged Strike you make with the weapon. Anytime the weapon is fired, the ammunition in its magazine is lowered by the number indicated. Other abilities might cite the use of Expend as the amount of ammo required to complete the action.
TraitDescription.Exposed: This armor doesn't come with environmental protections. All armor from Pathfinder has the exposed trait.
TraitDescription.Grenade: Weapons with this trait can be thrown as a single action using the Area Fire action as though it had the area (burst) trait.
TraitDescription.Installed: Some shields aren't held but are installed as armor or weapon upgrades. You can Raise a Shield installed as an armor upgrade as normal. Shields can be installed only into weapons with the parry trait. When you use a parry weapon with a shield upgrade to get a bonus to your AC, the shield upgrade emits an inertial dampening barrier and you automatically Raise a Shield. If you use the weapon for any other purpose, the shield is no longer raised, and you no longer receive a bonus to your AC. You can't Raise a Shield installed as an upgrade in any other way.
TraitDescription.Magitech: Magitech augmentations are a combination of cybernetic and magical components, containing elements such as mystically charged crystals, starmetal alloys, and rune-engraved microchips. Magitech augmentations are magical, but they can't be dispelled unless the effect or attack specifies that it affects augmentations.
TraitDescription.Manifestation: Feats with this trait enhance or alter your solar manifestations (flare, nimbus, and weapon), or allow you to create a new type of solar manifestation.
TraitDescription.Missile: Missiles are ammunition that can be loaded into and fired from missile launchers. Missiles have a single target and use an attack roll to deal damage, dealing the listed splash damage to anyone in the radius of the intended target (even if you miss your attack roll). Missiles are consumable items that are always expended when used. If you roll a critical hit against the target of a missile and apply the critical specialization effect of missiles, apply the effect only to the target of the attack.
TraitDescription.Ponderous: The armor has moving parts or other complications that lengthen the wearer's initial reaction time. While wearing the armor, you take a â€“1 item penalty to initiative rolls. If you don't meet the armor's required Strength score, this penalty increases to be equal to the armor's check penalty if it's worse.
TraitDescription.Powered: This melee weapon uses a battery. You can activate or deactivate a powered weapon with an Interact action or as part of drawing or stowing it. This weapon comes with a commercial battery installed and uses 1 charge per day (rather than 1 charge per attack). If you try to attack with a powered weapon that's out of charges or is deactivated, it functions as an improvised weapon.
TraitDescription.Professional: A weapon with this trait can be used as a tool for the listed skill. Add the weapon's item bonus to attack rolls as an item bonus to skill checks using the listed skill. For purposes of proficiency, you can choose to treat this martial weapon as a simple weapon or this advanced weapon as a martial weapon, up to your proficiency with the listed skill.
TraitDescription.RangedShove: This weapon can be used to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.7blmbDrQFNfdT731]{Shove} with the Athletics skill at a distance up to the weapon's first range increment. The skill check takes a â€“2 circumstance penalty. You can add the weapon's item bonus to attack rolls as a bonus to the check.
TraitDescription.Retractable: This shield can collapse into a smaller form attached to an armguard, gauntlet, glove, or jewelry for ease of travel and to free up hands. You can use an Interact action to deploy or retract the shield. You can't Raise a Shield if the shield is retracted. While it's deployed, you can Raise the Shield as long as you have that hand free or are holding an object of light Bulk that's not a weapon in that hand. The shield impedes the use of your hand while it's deployed. Though you can still hold items in that hand, you can't wield weapons in that hand or operate anything that takes two hands.
TraitDescription.Serum: These are pharmaceutical serums; they are technological, or perhaps hybrid in some cases, but can be crafted using a laboratory and don't incorporate significant magic. You can activate a serum with an Interact action as you drink it or feed it to another creature. You can feed a serum only to a creature that is within reach and willing or otherwise so helpless that it can't resist. You usually need only one appendage to activate a serum.
TraitDescription.suppressed: Creatures a soldier suppresses might receive additional conditions and other negative effects using feats with the suppressed trait; a soldier can only apply one such feat each time they use an action that confers the suppressed trait
TraitDescription.Tech: Items with the tech trait can be crafted by anyone, but if they also have the magical trait, they are hybrid items and require the Machine Magic feat to craft.
TraitDescription.Thought: Weapons with this trait are living creatures that can be communicated with using telepathy. When you wield this weapon and are capable of communicating with it, you can ignore any of the other traits the weapon normally has; this only applies to the other traits listed in the weapon entry, not traits the weapon or actions receive from the use of other abilities or effects. If you can communicate with this weapon, your proficiency with this weapon is equal to your proficiency with simple weapons.
TraitDescription.Tracking: This weapon has been developed with several integrated targeting, stabilizing, and homing systems. Attack rolls with this weapon gain an item bonus equal to the listed value. Area attacks with this weapon gain an item bonus equal to the listed value to the class DCs of saves.
TraitDescription.Transfer: These actions reduce Hit Points from your vitality network. You must have Hit Points in your vitality network equal to or greater than the transfer cost to use these actions. If you can't pay the cost, the action is disrupted.
TraitDescription.Unwieldy: Weapons with this trait are large and awkward, can't be fired without cooling down first, or are otherwise difficult to use with repeated attacks. You can't use an unwieldy weapon more than once per round and can't use it to Strike as part of a reaction, such as Reactive Strike.
TraitDescription.Upgrade: Weapons can be customized with upgrades, which include technological weapon modifications and weapon fusions. This indicates how many upgrades the weapon can utilize.
TraitDescription.Virtual: Items with the virtual trait are programs that must be installed on other computers, such as comm units. They require the Programmer feat to craft.
TraitDescription.Zone: These actions apply an additional effect to your quantum field. You may apply the effects of a zone only to a quantum field that doesn't have a zone effect.
